intro: Clypeola didyma, commonly known as the two-colored clypeola, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Clypeola didyma is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open woodland areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
